title: LECCIÓN 4
description: The document is about the general advice for formulating phytotherapeutic prescriptions. It includes sections on the parts of a prescription, dosage forms, quality control, homogeneity, simplicity, quantity, preparation, prescription time, precautions, organoleptic characteristics, dosage, and techniques for analysis and isolation of active ingredients.

title:
CONCEPTOS GENERALES DE UTILIZACIÓN DE LAS PLANTAS MEDICINALES Y SU
VISION ENERGÉTICA
description: This document provides an overview of the general concepts of using medicinal plants from an energetic perspective, primarily through the lens of Ayurveda. It delves into the three Doshas (Vata, Pitta, Kapha) outlining their physical, physiological, and psychological characteristics.  The document further explores the six tastes (sweet, sour, salty, pungent, bitter, astringent) in phytology, describing their properties and effects on the body. It concludes by explaining the concept of 'Vijaka' or post-digestive effect of these tastes and briefly touches upon the energy of plants.

title: Bolsa de pastor
description: This document describes a plant called Bolsa de pastor, its Latin name (capsella bursa - pastoris), family (brassicáceas), active principles, pharmacological action, indications, dosage, contraindications, and energetic aspect.

title: Las 50 Plantas Medicinales más utilizadas
description: This CD-ROM, produced by Eco Multimedia, features information on 50 of the most commonly used medicinal plants. Each plant entry includes its botanical name, definition, medicinal parts used, uses, properties, and contraindications. The content has been reviewed by experts Ignacio Abella and Joaquín Outón.

title: Castaño de Indias.
description: This document appears to be a botanical study of the Aesculus hippocastanum L., also known as the Horse Chestnut. It details the plant's Latin name, family, active ingredients found in the seeds and bark, pharmacological action, uses, dosage, contraindications, observations, and energetic aspects.

title: AJO
description: This document describes Garlic (AJO), its scientific name (Allium sativum), family (Liliáceas), active ingredients, pharmacological action, indications, precautions, contraindications, dosage, observations, and energetic aspects.
